column4: Hey ould someone help me mount an external hard drive (usb)??
I'm using ubuntu 8.04
I want to mount a usb hardd drive - maxtor brand
I'll restart?
sloopy is right.  what filesystem is your drive ?
open a terminal window and type 'sudo fdisk -l' withouth the quotes
with your external hard drive attached to your computer
ok now check what filesystem it is: hfs/ntfs/fat ...
ok lol :D
sloopy: yep that's right
does it work ?
Iol: I do the above in terminal (with or without sudo) and get 'Cannot create directory... Only root can do that...
your sudo command should do it :s
if you want to be able to use that drive on windows/mac too, you'd better use another fs
nah not at all. although I might partition of a section for that... I was thinking on installing intrepid on it--
yes, then ext3 will do
but not for the win/mac partition
that should be ntfs
post back if it works
sloopy: thank you :)
did you manage to mount it ?
cool, good luck
